intro: Guettarda rotundata, commonly known as the red hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its broad, round leaves and vibrant red or pink flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its flowers are five-petaled and have a distinctive, showy appearance, making it a popular ornamental plant. Guettarda rotundata thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
